header_summary:
Recent discussions within the digital transaction and Bitcoin development communities have illuminated several innovative approaches aimed at enhancing security, scalability, and economic efficiency. A consensus is emerging around the use of commit-based strategies as a preliminary step towards quantum-safe signatures, valued for their potential to incrementally strengthen security against emerging threats while allowing the ecosystem time to adapt ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/3f2c308b-13c2-47c9-b39e-861236601476n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#mfd66d2eb4a68cacae49f8d7e3adbba1c763512d6)). Parallelly, the Quantum-Resilient Modular Verification Layer (QRMVL) framework proposes a gradual, soft-fork-compatible path to quantum validation in Bitcoin, introducing a blend of hash-based signatures and efficient Merkle verification to address scalability challenges without compromising backward compatibility ([source](https://github.com/karinCrypto/bitcoin-quantum-scaling/blob/main/whitepaper/QRMVL%20v1%20A%20First%20Edition%20Framework%20for%20Quantum-Resilient%20Verification%20in%20Bitcoin_.pdf)).

In parallel, the discussion on SP wallets and label scanning challenged prevalent scalability concerns, presenting an alternative method through BIP-352 that promises efficiency regardless of label quantity, potentially enabling more robust applications of SP descriptor formats without performance degradation ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/59b1879d-b43d-41ac-9b3e-3e65cf31d4e5n@googlegroups.com/T/#ma25b2a2b7c0342efe823ca51e5aa0f95e673e013)). Additionally, the discourse on Bitcoin's economic infrastructure, particularly the adjustments to the default minimum relay feerate and its impact on transaction consolidation, underscores the importance of addressing inefficiencies at the wallet or user experience level rather than through protocol modifications, highlighting the dynamic and adaptable nature of Bitcoin policy development ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAOj3_X8cJLJChvv3-QSGA8j5MVwgYxn1BAUeugTTgiqUWzEK_Q@mail.gmail.com/T/#mb5720bad34ecc7ff3224b89c783a7d2e9cf96635)).

These discussions reflect a broader trend within the Bitcoin development community towards innovative, pragmatic solutions that address current and future challenges while remaining grounded in the principles of security, scalability, and economic efficiency. The willingness to explore new methodologies and the active solicitation of community feedback point towards a vibrant, evolving digital transaction ecosystem poised to adapt to both technological advancements and changing user needs.

recent_posts.title: QRMVL: Modular Verification Layer for Post-Quantum Hash-Based Signatures
recent_posts.summary:
- Commit-based strategies enhance digital transaction security by preventing MITM attacks and facilitating quantum resistance.
- The Quantum-Resilient Modular Verification Layer (QRMVL) introduces a soft-fork for Bitcoin, ensuring PQ verification scalability.
- Feedback on QRMVL's implementation and technical specifications is sought, with resources available on GitHub for community review.

recent_posts.title: [BIP Proposal] Add sp() output descriptor format for BIP352
recent_posts.summary:
- The email debates label scanning costs and scalability in SP wallets, questioning current beliefs.
- Alternative methodologies, like BIP-352, show label scanning cost doesn't depend on label counts.
- Findings suggest, with appropriate techniques, label scanning scales well, challenging prevailing views.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: DustSweep – policy-only UTXO dust compaction
recent_posts.summary:
- The default minimum relay feerate for Bitcoin has been lowered to 0.1 sat/vB.
- Strategies at the protocol or policy level for improving transaction efficiency may be reevaluated.
- The discussion highlights the significance of adaptability and feedback in Bitcoin's policy development.

recent_posts.title: Major BIP 360 Update
recent_posts.summary:

- It is actually a Merkle root, not limited to tapscript.
- "Pay to script tree merkle root" is suggested for clarity and accuracy.

recent_posts.title: A Proposal for Trustless Custody

recent_posts.title: BMAX: pricing “sats now vs sats later” via a mining sharechain (no L1 changes, no custodians, no oracles)
recent_posts.summary:
- Hashpool enables future mining share valuation through a discounted marketplace.
- BMAX integrates Bitcoin nodes and on-chain metrics for internal settlements.
- The analysis explores the economic rationale behind immediate liquidity for miners.

active_posts.title: Unbreaking testnet4
active_posts.summary:
- Testnet4 aimed to improve over Testnet3 but kept a problematic difficulty reset rule.
- A flag day hard fork plans to remove this rule by January 1, 2026, for smoother operations.
- This change seeks a balance between a realistic test environment and developer accessibility.

active_posts.title: Hash-Based Signatures for Bitcoin's Post-Quantum Future
active_posts.summary:
- Hash-based cryptographic solutions for Bitcoin focus on security against quantum attacks.
- Optimizations can reduce the large signature sizes of hash-based schemes like SPHINCS+ without losing security.
- The discussion urges the Bitcoin community to consider post-quantum cryptographic solutions' practicality and security.

active_posts.title: Re: The Cat, BIP draft discussion.
active_posts.summary:
- The email details a debate on Bitcoin's spam mitigation proposal, "The Cat".
- Critics find spam mitigation clashes with Bitcoin's decentralized ethos, yet see practical benefits.
- "The Cat" suggests deleting "junk" UTXOs, raising efficiency but sparking ethical concerns.

active_posts.title: P2share: how to turn any network (or testnet!) into a bitcoin miner
active_posts.summary:
- The p2share network innovates mining rewards distribution, giving entire bitcoin rewards to random shareholders.
- It aims for fairness, efficiency, and decentralization by using shares and upkeeping a trustless system.
- This model might impact Bitcoin's security positively, offering a novel approach to rewards and mining participation.

active_posts.title: Understanding and Mitigating a OP_CTV Footgun: The Unsatisfiable UTXO
active_posts.summary:
- `OP_CTV` introduces challenges in transaction input management, emphasizing multiple inputs for error prevention.
- Incorporating at least two inputs in `OP_CTV` templates mitigates the risk of unspendable UTXOs.
- Ongoing research seeks to enhance Bitcoin security and efficiency by integrating `OP_CTV` with new proposals.

active_posts.title: Scaling Noncustodial Mining Payouts with CTV
active_posts.summary:
- Mining pools combine computational resources for better chances at earning cryptocurrency rewards.
- The Ocean mining pool, a non-custodial operator, overcomes hardware limitations with innovative techniques.
- CTV protocol enhancement and further research aim to improve non-custodial reward distribution efficiency.

today_in_history_posts.title: Why Full-RBF Makes DoS Attacks on Multiparty Protocols Significantly More Expensive
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Full-RBF removal from Bitcoin was primarily due to tx-pinning concerns.
- It exposes multi-party protocols to double-spend attacks by delaying transaction mining.
- Despite its drawbacks, full-RBF significantly benefits multi-party protocols in Bitcoin.

today_in_history_posts.title: Swap-in-Potentiam: Moving Onchain Funds "Instantly" To Lightning
today_in_history_posts.summary:
